com.inqwell.any

Class EventMultiplexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inqwell.any.AbstractAny
      • com.inqwell.any.EventMultiplexer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Any, EventGenerator, EventListener, Serializable, Cloneable

    public class EventMultiplexer
extends AbstractAny
implements EventGenerator, EventListener, Cloneable
    An event listener and generator which propagates events to multiple listeners.

    This class is useful for those cases where there might be multiple listeners for an event but for which we don't want to connect to the actual source until all those listeners are set up.

    It might also be the case that an event generator only supports one listsner at any one time, for example Map implementations whose one and only listener is usually their parent.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.5 $
    Author:
    $Author: sanderst $
    See Also:

      • makeEvent

        public Event makeEvent(Any eventType)
        Description copied from interface: EventGenerator
        An optional operation which is implemented by true event originators, as opposed to those generators which merely act as propagators. Yields an event of the specified type provided that type is valid for this EventGenerator.

        Parameters:

      • getDesiredEventTypes

        public Array getDesiredEventTypes()
        Description copied from interface: EventListener
        Returns the event types this listener would like to listen to. Can be called by an EventGenerator's addEventListener() methods for those cases where the generator supports subscription to specific event types and the listener wishes to specify the event types it wants to receive notification of.
        Specified by:
        getDesiredEventTypes in interface EventListener
